BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN
PSYCHOLOGY
LEVEL 1
AREA IX
LABORATORIES

BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN
PSYCHOLOGY
LEVEL 1
AREA IX
LABORATORIES
PARAMETER A – LABORATORIES , SHOPS,
AND FACILITIES

I. SYSTEMS –
INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.1. The layout of the
campus is presented
showing the location of
the laboratory rooms/
shops utilized in the
program and its
conformity to RA 6541-
National Building Code
of the Philippines & PD
856 – Code of Sanitation
of the Philippines

The Science Room/
Biology Laboratory is
located in the Second
Floor of Martina S.
Ferrer Building

The Computer
Laboratory is located
in the 2nd Floor of
Teofilo Genuino
Building

The Testing Room
and Psychology Room
is located in the 3rd
Floor of Teofilo
Genuino Building

Copy of the BS
Psychology (Old
Curriculum) Checklist
(Courses/subjects with
laboratory are
highlighted.)

Copy of the BS
Psychology (New
Curriculum) Checklist
(Courses/subjects with
laboratory are
highlighted.)

PROCESSES

conforms to the
standard
requirements of
fluorescent bulbs
relative to the size of
the room

I. SYSTEMS –
INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.4. Each laboratory
has at least two exit
doors that open
outward.

Doors in the Laboratory
rooms open inward

I. SYSTEMS –
INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.5. There is a
laboratory for shop
work for specific
technologies.

Click to see the file
CMO No. 34 S. 2017
Policies and Standards
for Undergraduate
Programs in
Psychology
Psychology Room
Testing Room

Testing Materials are
kept locked in the
vault and may only
be opened by the
Testing Room in-
charge.

I. SYSTEMS –
INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.6. There is a
computer laboratory
with at least 15 usable
computer units and a
printer.

Computer Laboratory
Equipment Inventory

Computer with
Printer

I. SYSTEMS –
INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.7. A laboratory space
of 2 sq.m. per student
with a total area of 70
sq.m. is provided.

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.1.
Furniture/Equipment
arrangement allows
free flow of
movement and
enables student to
work comfortable
without interference.
Psychology Room
Testing Room

Science Room for
Demonstration

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.2. Safety and
precautionary
measures are
implemented.

New Normal Safety
Protocols are implemented
in the campus

All visitors, faculty and staff must have
their temperature taken by the guard
before entering the premises. Visitors
showing symptoms of COVID-19 will
not be allowed entry.

Fire Extinguisher in
Psychology Room

Fire Extinguisher in
Science Room

Fire Extinguisher in
Computer Laboratory

Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.3. Usable fire
extinguishers are
accessible to staff and
students.

Fire Extinguisher in
Psychology Room

Fire Extinguisher in
Science Room

Fire Extinguisher in
Computer Laboratory

Memo on Creation of
Pollution Control,
Waste Segregation,
Environmental
Management Policies,
ECC all memo on
waste

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.4. Laboratory
operations manuals
for the faculty and
students are provided
in each laboratory.

Sample Laboratory Operations
Manual in the Science Room
for the faculty and students is
present.

Computer laboratory procedures, policies,
and guidelines in the computer laboratory
are posted conspicuously.

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.5. Demonstration
and training on the
proper use of fire
extinguishers, first aid
kit and other
emergency measures
are periodically
conducted.

Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit
Earthquake Drill

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.6. A well-equipped
first aid kit, charts for
antidotes and
neutralizing solutions
are always available in
each laboratory room.

First Aid Kit is available
in the laboratory

Approved Purchase
Requests for Medical
Supplies

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.7. A student’s access
to a computer is at
least 15 hours per term
for every subject.

II.
IMPLEMENTATION
I.8. Appropriate
laboratories for
general education
subjects are
adequately equipped
and well-maintained.
Speech Laboratory

Science Room for
Demonstration

Science Room for
Demonstration

IMPLEMENTATION

Multimedia Center is
maintained.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.11. A demonstration
table, equipped with

IMPLEMENTATION
I.12. Laboratory
supplies and
equipment are kept
separate in separate
stock rooms.

III. OUTCOME/S
O.1. The laboratories
and shops are well-
equipped, functional
and are conducive to
learning.
